name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Inn of Sedona

reviews.text: The community patios were spacious with plenty of tables and chairs. Loved sitting out on the patio ,enjoying the view of the red rocks in the morning and in the evening. So relaxing.
reviews.title: Loved the large patio and the view.

likes.liked: — The location. To the red rocks and to bus tour of Grand Canyon

reviews.text: At first it appeard there was no handicap access to our level but we did discover parking on the street easily accessible to the sidewalk. The street only led to the hotel so traffic was not an issue. Made it much easier toting luggage at our departure. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Do not confuse the two..

reviews.text: The Best Western Inn of Sedona IS NOT the same hotel as the Best Western Arroyo Roble Hotel and Creekside Villas in Sedona - if you are making reservations, DO NOT confuse the two. For the right price, the Best Western Inn of Sedona is fine for a nights stay (maybe 2) - they offer free wifi in room and a decent free breakfast in the morning (coffee pot in rooms, with a small fridge) - the open terraced building (each floor w/ the exception of the first, shares open communal patio space, some with great views, others overlook the parking area) offer a little relief from the run of the mill strip hotel. The pool and pool deck area are SMALL, I think there might have been a hot tub - we stayed away from both. If I was planning on spending much time in my hotel room while in Sedona, I'd look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Excellent choice for my 3 night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I couldn't have been happier. The clerk at the front desk gave me excellent dinner recommendations for 3 nights and they were all very good.
reviews.title: Good value in the area

likes.disliked: — decor could have been better, more attention to thorough cleanliness

reviews.text: The hotel is located just off the main road so you don't hear any road noise. The entire property had the look a new hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, lack luster desk staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The local Chamber of Commerce recommended this Best Western. We arrived early afternoon in Sedona and needed somewhere to stay.
reviews.title: spectacular views and spectacular prices!

reviews.text: The views from the hotel are spectacular and many guests spent a good deal of time after breakfast with their cameras. However, you don't get much for your money here. Our second floor room was basic with the exception of the towels- must be the best in Arizona! There were dirty cups left by the coffee-maker and no clean ones. When I complained at reception, the next door room had no sheets or any coffee so I suppose we were lucky. Even the receptionist agreed that the housekeeping was poor.
reviews.title: Great location, very basic accommodations

likes.disliked: — Very basic room for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sedona goes to bed very early and that means an early evening meal if you can find somewhere open. The hotel is badly lit at night and we struggled to climb the steps to our room safely.
reviews.title: Beautiful getaway!
Great views but.......
reviews.text: Breakfast is reasonable but the lady in charge makes sure you don't take too much.

reviews.title: Fantastic location. Very relaxing
reviews.text: Advice to those who want to enjoy the beauty of Sedona ....book ahead and expect to pay big bucks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is within a short driving distance to all the major sights of Sedona. It is a good value and nicely maintained. In the mornings there is a complimentary continental breakfast with hard boiled eggs, waffles and pastries. The hotel rooms have glass back doors that open out onto a shared patio. There were tables and chairs to sit at to enjoy the views. The beds were very comfortable and the room was clean and tastefully decorated. If you are traveling through Sedona for a short time or if you will be having an active vacation in which you are looking for sights and outdoor experiences verses a spa vacation I would recommend this hotel. If you’re in Sedona during the Christmas season check out the festival of lights at the Los Abrigados Resort. If you are in Sedona in the summer take a whirl down Slide Rock. Check out my pictures to see the room.
reviews.title: Good location, value

reviews.text: Well Trip Advisor you did it again....I have yet to have a bad experience using your web site and this time is no exception....after long deliberations and lots of second guessing my family and I decided to stay at the Best Western Inn of Sedona, Arizona and let me just say the experience was awesome......
reviews.title: The Perfect spot for the price!

likes.liked: — The locale, surrounded by gorgeous mountains and views
likes.disliked: — The pool is a bit small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is wonderfully situated on a hillside and you are surrounded by spectacular views and vistas.....the sunset was incredible only to be topped off by the sunrise which was incredible as well......
reviews.title: great views
Best Western Inn at Sedona
reviews.text: The rooms are nicely appointed, clean, a bit small but who needs anything bigger when your outdoors all the time.....a great value, the breakfast buffet was very good and a nice selection of items....coffee was great......we were there for the Thanksgiving holiday and the concierge made reservations for us at two outstanding restaurants....guests should really use her services.....So fellow trip advisors if you are heading to Sedona, Arizona the Best Western Inn of Sedona is an outstanding place to rest your head for a good value.

reviews.title: What views! What staff! Best of the Best Westerns!
reviews.text: Good sized room,clean & comfortable.Staff helpful especially the concierge who sorted out a trip with Pink Jeeps with hotel pickuk.Also available was a courtesy minibus service into the main part of Sedona ( a fair walk).Judi`s restaurant next door very good.Complimentary b`fst good & plentiful.The view outside our room was terrific.....enjoyed a glass of wine each evening -the table & chairs provided outside our door.Would love to return....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Inn of Sedona situated on the Western side of the town just off a very busy main road. It had great views of the famous red rocks and a walk away from an excellent health food store and various cafes.
reviews.title: Red Rocks of Sedona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first room we were given was smokey when we entered, we mentioned this to reception and they changed our room immediately. A word of advice - if you find your room has also had someone smoking in it, you may find yourselves liable to an extra charge if you don't report it! Not sure why the cleaning staff hadn't done it for our room.
reviews.title: Seniors AVOID!!

reviews.text: The room was clean and comfortable with great views of the rocks and morning sun, it had a good supply of towels and toiletries which were replaced daily. The main problem was the heating/air conditoner which was very noisy when turned on. As it was very cold at night, the fan turned on and off throughout the night making a lot of noise each time it came on. We gave up and turned it off for a peaceful night.. Extra layers required!
reviews.title: Wonderful View from the terrace!

reviews.text: The breakfast area was rather basic with very poor lighting but a reasonable simple meal was possible. Very much a help yourself style, with little help from the staff.
reviews.title: Away From it all!

reviews.text: The concierge was very helpful and arranged our excellent trips to the Grand Canyon (Pink Jeep) and the Verde Canyon, both are very highly recommended.
reviews.title: Surprisingly affordable with great service!

aka: Best Western Plus Inn Of Sedona Hotel Sedona
description: With amazing views of Sedona's red rocks from Promenade Terraces; upgraded amenities including a full hot breakfast; and caring service from a great team of friendly people, this Sedona hotel will become your home away from home whenever you visit the red rocks. We love Sedona, and we want you to love it too!
